snippet: Though Mr. Bush is deeply conservative on some issues, in other ways — culturally and philosophically — he is out of step with the grass-roots activists who animate the party nowadays.
abstract: Former Florida Gov Jeb Bush, considering a presidential run in 2016, is grappling with whether he can prevail in grueling primary battle without shifting his positions or altering his persona to satisfy Republican Party's conservative base; Bush is aligned with them on issues like taxes and abortion, but has pushed Republicans to find consensus with Democrats on other issues, particularly fiscal policies.
lead_paragraph: Though Mr. Bush is deeply conservative on some issues, in other ways — culturally and philosophically — he is out of step with the grass-roots activists who animate the party nowadays.

headline.main: In New Election, Jeb Bush Stakes Out the Middle Ground
headline.print_headline: Looking to ’16, Another Bush Stakes Out the Middle Ground
